Label: LABEL
Definition: A definition
Question Description: A question description

Label: aims and objectives
Definition: The reason for performing a study in terms of the scientific questions to be answered by the analysis of data collected during the study.
Question Description: What are the aims and objectives of your cohort?

Label: timeline
Definition: A chronological schedule of when activities or events occurred or will occur.
Question Description: What is the timeline for your cohort study?

Label: study design
Definition: A plan detailing how a study will be performed in order to represent the phenomenon under examination, to answer the research questions that have been asked, and defining the methods of data analysis. Study design is driven by research hypothesis being posed, study subject/population/sample available, logistics/resources: technology, support, networking, collaborative support, etc.‚Ä¶
Question Description: What is the study design for your cohort study?

Label: location
Definition: A position, site, or point in space where something can be found.
Question Description: What location is your cohort's population based in?

Label: criteria for enrollment and recruitment procedures
Definition: Medical and/or social characteristics which are necessary for a subject to be allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. Meeting inclusion criteria is not a sufficient condition for entry or recruitment of a subject into the study. Characteristics limiting the eligibility of a subject for the clinical study must be considered
Question Description: What is your cohort's criteria of enrollment or recruitment procedures?

Label: num. participants
Definition: The number of subjects entered in a clinical trial.
Question Description: What are the number of participants in your cohort?

Label: gender(s) studied in cohort
Question Description: How many of each gender are studied in your cohort?

Label: age range
Question Description: What is the age range of your cohort's participants?

Label: data collection events
Question Description: If data was collected over several events or time points, what are the events or time points?

Label: urine
Definition: The fluid that is excreted by the kidneys. It is stored in the bladder and discharged through the urethra.
Question Description: Have you collected this type of biosample?

Label: venous or arterial
Definition: A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood.

Label: stool
Definition: The material discharged from the bowel during defecation. It consists of undigested food, intestinal mucus, epithelial cells, and bacteria.

Label: saliva
Definition: The watery fluid in the mouth made by the salivary glands. Saliva moistens food to help digestion and it helps protect the mouth against infections.

Label: availability
Definition: The quality of being obtainable or accessible and ready for use or service.
Question Description: For each data type present, is it available/accessible for research?

Label: sample size
Definition: A subset of a larger population, selected for investigation to draw conclusions or make estimates about the larger population.
Question Description: For each data type present, what is the sample size?

Label: processing method
Definition: The system of methods followed in a particular discipline.
Question Description: For each data type present, what was the processing method used (eg. sequencer/software)?

Label: storage method
Definition: An administrative activity defined at a global library level that is an action of storing samples.
Question Description: For each biosample present, what is the storage method?

Label: microbial data
Question Description: Have you collected microbial data?

Label: biosample source/anatomical location
Definition: A request to identify the specimen source site.
Question Description: From where (specimen source site) have you collected microbial data?

Label: available data format(s)
Definition: The organization of information according to preset specifications.
Question Description: For each data type present, what are the available data formats?

Label: DNA/Genotyping
Question Description: Have you collected this type of data?

Label: Sequence variants
Definition: The analysis of all of the single nucleotide polymorphisms in the genome of a biological sample.

Label: Epigenetics
Definition: The analysis of all of the epigenetic DNA modifications in the genome a biological sample.

Label: Metagenomics
Definition: A molecular assay that is used to analyze metagenomic data; genetic material recovered directly from environmental samples for genomic research.

Label: RNAseq/gene expression
Definition: A procedure that can determine the RNA sequences for all or part of the poly-A tail-containing messenger RNA transcripts in an individual.

Label: eQTL
Definition: A stretch of DNA at a particular chromosomal location that is able to regulate the expression of a specific mRNA or protein.

Label: associated cell type/tissue type/biosample
Definition: A request to identify the specimen source site.
Question Description: For each data type present, what are the associated cell/tissue/biosample types?

Label: associated phenotype
Definition: Any genetically determined characteristic/The assemblage of traits or outward appearance of an individual. It is the product of interactions between genes and between genes and the environment.
Question Description: For each data type present, what are the associated phenotype(s)?

Label: associated disease
Definition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.
Question Description: For each data type present, what are the associated diseases?

Label: associated medication
Question Description: For each data type present, what are the associated medications?

Label: date and time-related information
Definition: The date (and time) on which an assessment is completed.
Question Description: Have you collected the date/time of survey assessments?

Label: consent/accessibility
Definition: Consent by a patient to a surgical or medical procedure or participation in a clinical study after achieving an understanding of the relevant medical facts and the risks involved.
Question Description: Is there consent for your survey data to be accessible for research?

Label: unique identifiers
Definition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.
Question Description: Are there unique identifiers for subjects/participants?

Label: age/birthdate
Question Description: If this data type is present, what are the associated variables from your cohort's survey/questionnaire? For each associated variable, what is the data type (eg. categorical/binary/numeric/alphanumeric/datetime), the data collection event or time point (if applicable), the population type (if there are different participants sharing one identifier; eg. child, mother, father)?

Label: biological sex
Definition: The assemblage of physical properties or qualities by which male is distinguished from female; the physical difference between male and female; the distinguishing peculiarity of male or female.

Label: gender
Definition: The assemblage of properties that distinguish people on the basis of the societal roles expected for the two sexes.

Label: ethnicity/race
Definition: A social group characterized by a distinctive social and cultural tradition that is maintained from generation to generation. Members share a common history and origin and a sense of identification with the group. They have similar and distinctive features in their lifestyle habits and shared experiences. They often have a common genetic heritage which may be reflected in their experience of health and disease...

Label: residence
Definition: Any address at which a person dwells more than temporarily.

Label: education
Definition: The activities of educating or instructing or teaching; activities that impart knowledge or skill.

Label: tobacco
Definition: A record of an individual's background in regard to smoking tobacco. This would include such factors as start date, end date (if applicable), number of cigarette smoked, attempts to quit, and others.

Label: alcohol
Definition: A description of an individual's current and past experience with alcoholic beverage consumption.

Label: physical activity
Definition: A measurement of a subject's physical activity or movement.

Label: sleep
Definition: A natural and periodic state of rest during which consciousness of the world is suspended.

Label: nutrition
Definition: That which is consumed to fuel necessary life processes of an organism.

Label: physician/practitioner info
Definition: The physician responsible for the admission of a patient to a hospital or other inpatient health institution. The admitting physician evaluates patients, makes admitting decisions and assesses diagnostic and treatment plans

Label: blood-related disorders
Definition: Any deviation from the normal structure or function of the blood or lymphatic system that is manifested by a characteristic set of symptoms and signs.

Label: endocrine/nutritional/metabolic disorders
Definition: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder that affects the endocrine system. Representative examples of non-neoplastic disorders include diabetes mellitus, hyperthyroidism, and adrenal gland insufficiency. Representative examples of neoplastic disorders include carcinoid tumor, neuroendocrine carcinoma, and pheochromocytoma.‚Ä¶

Label: mental and behaviour disorders
Definition: A disorder characterized by behavioral and/or psychological abnormalities, often accompanied by physical symptoms. The symptoms may cause clinically significant distress or impairment in social and occupational areas of functioning. Representative examples include anxiety disorders, cognitive disorders, mood disorders and schizophrenia.‚Ä¶/A specific behavioral problem that occurs in persistent patterns and characteristic clusters and that causes clinically significant impairment.

Label: nervous system
Definition: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder that affects the brain, spinal cord, or peripheral nerves.

Label: digestive system
Definition: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder that affects the gastrointestinal tract, anus, liver, biliary system, and pancreas.

Label: respiratory system
Definition: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder that affects the respiratory system. Representative examples include pneumonia, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, pulmonary failure, lung adenoma, lung carcinoma, and tracheal carcinoma.

Label: weight
Definition: The vertical force exerted by a mass as a result of gravity.

Label: height
Definition: The vertical measurement or distance from the base to the top of an object; the vertical dimension of extension.

Label: blood pressure
Definition: The pressure of the circulating blood against the walls of the blood vessels.

Label: heart rate
Definition: The number of heartbeats per unit of time, usually expressed as beats per minute.

Label: prescription
Definition: A verbal or written order given by an authorized person instructing a patient to obtain and use a medical device, prescription or undergo a procedure.

Label: posology
Definition: The specific way a therapeutic drug is to be taken, including formulation, route of administration, dose, dosing interval, and treatment duration.

Label: life stage/time point
Definition: A designation assigned to a particular period during a life cycle, generally defined by chronological parameters.

Label: general research data documents
Definition: Any item with which a scientist works.

Label: summary statistics for additional data from federated sources
Definition: Records pertaining to the statistical analyses and reports of a clinical trial.
Question Description: *** need to confirm: these are existing statistical analyses that can complement Use Case 5.2's analyses?
